title: Custom Dual Squelcher
content:
The Custom Dual Squelcher is a main weapon in Splatoon. It is a Custom-branded version of the Dual Squelcher. Just like its main counterpart in Splatoon 2, it was reworked into the Custom Dualie Squelchers.

- 1 Appearance

- 2 Splatoon

2.2 Version history

The Custom Dual Squelcher is nearly identical in appearance to the Dual Squelcher. The only difference between the two is that the Custom Dual Squelcher has a sticker bearing the Custom logo on the bottom part of the gun.

The Custom Dual Squelcher was released on 27 June 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It comes as a set with Squid Beakons and the Killer Wail.

- The Custom Dual Squelcher is a middleweight weapon.

- Each shot consumes 1.2% of the ink tank capacity.
This allows players to fire 83 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This allows players to fire 83 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When firing continuously, it shoots a bullet every 6 frames (10 shots per second).

- When firing while moving, the player's movement speed is set to 0.6 units per frame.

- After firing, there is a 20 frame cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.

- Each shot has a base damage of 28.

- Shots travel straight for 6 frames. After that, they may lose damage. A shot will lose damage until it reaches 14 damage at frame 18.

- Shots have a radius of 2 units.

- The angle its shots can deviate while on the ground is 4 degrees.

- The angle its shots can deviate while in the air is 12 degrees.

- The outer reticle immediately expands after jumping. The outer reticle will finish shrinking after 60 frames.

- The chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle increases by 2% per shot, and maximizes at a 25% chance to shoot towards the outer reticle.
This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

- When jumping, the chance to shoot towards the outer reticle instead of the inner reticle is immediately set to 40%.

- Accuracy starts recovering 6 frames after the player stops shooting.

- Shots initially travel straight at a rate of 22 units per frame for 6 frames. Shots travel straight for 132 distance units.

- Ink droplets occur every 105 units.

- The frequency at which ink drips from a shot occurs at a rate of 2 droplets per shot.

- There are a total of 8 different droplet patterns that can be created while firing this weapon.

- Droplets that occur within 11 units of the player have a radius of 21 units.

- Droplets that occur when they travel past 200 units of the player have a radius of 18.5 units.

- All other ink droplets have a radius of 13 units.

- This allows players to fire 83 shots before needing to refill the ink supply.

- This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- This means that it takes 13 shots to reach minimum accuracy.

[2]

- ▲ Walk speed while firing increased by 20%.

- ▲ Special gauge loss: 50% → 40%.

The Custom Dual Squelcher is exactly what it sounds like - a Dual Squelcher with a custom look! What's new is the Squid Beakon, letting you lead your team, and the Killer Wail to pressure your foes! I'd say it's perfect for master tacticians who can keep track of the entire field of battle.(NA)
